On 8/24/06, Elliotte Harold <elharo@...> wrote:
>
>
> However t=
his can conflict with your response to point 1. What if a
> constructor nee=
ds to open a file? And for that matter why do files have
> to be opened any=
way? Perhaps file writes and reads should auto-open and
> close files as ne=
cessary.


Yes.  Operations that need to be mirrored (opening/closing) prob=
ably don't
belong in the constructor since Java doesn't give us an obvious
=
counterpart.  Putting them in a BeforeClass/AfterClass or
BeforeSuite/After=
Suite probably makes more sense.

Pushing this point further, seeing an ope=
ration that requires later clean up
in a constructor could arguably be seen=
 as a design smell...

-- 
C=E9dric
